programme.title: 2025 WNBA Draft
programme.desc: Dallas Wings hold the No. 1 pick in the 2025 WNBA Draft, followed by Seattle and Washington, as teams address needs on their rosters; Paige Bueckers, Olivia Miles and Kiki Iriafen are top prospects expected to hear their names early.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Seattle won its last two meetings with Los Angeles, including a 2-1 win on April 7 behind goals from Matty Beniers and Brandon Montour, after losing four of the previous five to the Kings, who got a goal from Quinton Byfield in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: New York won its last two home meetings with Washington after a 4-1 victory on April 6 behind two goals from Marc Gatcomb and 28 saves from Iyla Sorokin; Alex Ovechkin scored the lone goal for the Capitals to surpass Wayne Gretzky's goal record.

programme.desc: NFL Draft experts analyze the quarterback class and review potential landing spots; top names expected to hear their name called early include: Miami's Cam Ward, Colorado's Shedeur Sanders, Alabama's Jalen Milroe and Ole Miss' Jaxson Dart.

programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. and Todd McShay expound on their mock drafts, alternating picks through three rounds to predict how the 32 teams fill several holes on their roster, the players they believe who have improved their stock and the names that could fall.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin won back-to-back Cup Series races for the first time since 2012 following his victory at Darlington over points leader William Byron; Hamlin and Kyle Larson won the two races at Bristol last year over Martin Truex Jr. and Chase Elliott.

programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Columbus claimed victories over Vegas in their first two meetings of the 2025 season, winning the most recent matchup on March 14 with a 3-0 scoreline; Izabella Rapacz posted a game-leading 20 kills for the Fury in the win at home.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased its lead over Pato O'Ward to 39 points after winning at Thermal Club for a second-straight victory; Scott Dixon averaged 98.35 mph en route to his win at Long Beach last year over Colton Herta.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Arlington (2-0) remained undefeated with an 11-9 win over Houston behind 211 passing yards and a touchdown from Luis Perez; Birmingham (1-1) rebounded from its loss to DC with a 21-12 win over Michigan behind Matt Corral and Deon Cain.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Two-time champion Francesco Bagnaia secured his first win of the season with his victory at COTA, while Alex Marquez passed his brother, Marc, in the standings by one point; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Qatar last year over Brad Binder.
